briefTitle: Safety of Two Trivalent Influenza Vaccines Evaluated in Children and Adolescents 4 to 17 Years of Age
officialTitle: A Phase III, Observer Blind, Randomized, Controlled, Multicenter Study to Evaluate the Safety of a Trivalent Subunit Influenza Vaccine Produced Either in Mammalian Cell Culture or in Embryonated Chicken Eggs (Fluvirin®), in Healthy Children and Adolescents 4 to 17 Years of Age.
summary: Evaluate safety and tolerability of TIVa or TIVb vaccine in healthy children and adolescents 4 to 17 years of age.

primaryOutcome.measure: Number Of Subjects Reporting Solicited Local and Systemic Adverse Events and Other Indicators Of Reactogenicity After Any Vaccination.
primaryOutcome.timeFrame: Day 1 to Day 7 after any vaccination
